definitions.definition: ( Scotland , dialect ) A convulsive fit of coughing or laughter; a sonorous indraft of breath; a whoop ; a gasp of breath caused by laughing, coughing, or crying.

main_definition: ( Scotland , dialect ) A convulsive fit of coughing or laughter; a sonorous indraft of breath; a whoop ; a gasp of breath caused by laughing, coughing, or crying.

definitions.definition: A tight curl , twist , or bend in a length of thin material , hair etc.
examples: We couldn't get enough water to put out the fire because of a kink in the hose.

definitions.definition: A difficulty or flaw that is likely to impede operation , as in a plan or system .
examples: They had planned to open another shop downtown, but their plan had a few kinks .

definitions.definition: An unreasonable notion ; a crotchet ; a whim ; a caprice .
Peculiarity or deviation in sexual behaviour or taste .
A person with peculiar sexual tastes.
A positive 1- soliton solution to the sine-Gordon equation .

main_definition: A tight curl , twist , or bend in a length of thin material , hair etc.
secondary_definitions: A difficulty or flaw that is likely to impede operation , as in a plan or system .
An unreasonable notion ; a crotchet ; a whim ; a caprice .
( informal , countable or uncountable ) Peculiarity or deviation in sexual behaviour or taste .
( informal , countable ) A person with peculiar sexual tastes.
( mathematics ) A positive 1- soliton solution to the sine-Gordon equation .
